DataElement.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary skin melanoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin. Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi. Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma
Concepts.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Pathologic
Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/9/18 tt moved to NCI Standards Context. Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system does not apply to melanoma of the conjunctiva, melanoma of the uvea, mucosal melanoma arising in the head and neck, and mucosal melanoma of the urethra, vagina, rectum, and anus. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT4b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma measuring more than 4.0 mm in thickness. Ulceration status: With ulceration. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT4b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma measuring more than 4.0 mm in thickness. Ulceration status: With ulceration. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pT1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma measuring less than 0.8 mm in thickness with ulceration, or 0.8-1.0 mm with or without ulceration. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma measuring less than 0.8 mm in thickness with ulceration, or 0.8-1.0 mm with or without ulceration. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma measuring 1.0 mm or less in thickness. Ulceration status: Unknown or unspecified. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pTis TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pTis TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with a finding of melanoma in situ. Thickness: Not applicable. Ulceration status: Not applicable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pTis TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with a finding of melanoma in situ. Thickness: Not applicable. Ulceration status: Not applicable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with no evidence of primary tumor (e.g., unknown primary or completely regressed melanoma). Thickness: Not applicable. Ulceration status: Not applicable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with no evidence of primary tumor (e.g., unknown primary or completely regressed melanoma). Thickness: Not applicable. Ulceration status: Not applicable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma in which the primary tumor thickness cannot be assessed (e.g., diagnosis by curettage). Thickness: Not applicable. Ulceration status: Not applicable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma in which the primary tumor thickness cannot be assessed (e.g., diagnosis by curettage). Thickness: Not applicable. Ulceration status: Not applicable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
